ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: We have learned the intricacies of Free Speech and the First Amendment, with a particular focus on how these rights are considered within the digital realm of social media.

My knowledge of the First Amendment, and the Supreme Court's treatment of it increased dramatically.  The greatest insights were how the social media platforms may, or may not, be protected by the First Amendment.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: There is a lot of material to cover but not a lot of time to cover it due to the course being taught over the summer. However, KG does an excellent job of facilitating discussion and questions.

Strengths included:
1.  The instructor required class participation and did so by assigning students to address one of the days' readings.  That worked well.
2.  There was a lot of reading / watching documentaries and other items on the internet.   I learned a lot about how much is offered on the internet.
3.  There was much information on the problems facing social media platforms and how the government may try to help address those problems.  Very interesting.
Only weakness I can think of were some of the students - - some were not prepared or not listening or simply unwilling to volunteer.  There were several who were prepared, did volunteer and were quite impressive.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to everyone as it gives excellent insight into some of the fundamental rights of American citizens.

Yes.  This area of the law is very topical.  Daily there are articles in the NY Times that raise a First Amendment issue.  Also, much of the course is devoted to social media platforms - - which are so central to most student lives now.
The Professor is a judge. She speaks with years of experience and really analyzes cases for their legal dilemmas. Our discussions were so topical and engaging.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments: I will certainly go about my day-to-day life with better insight and knowledge of my rights and how I can use those rights within the society I interact with.

For insights into current issues and to assist friends who have questions about Supreme Court issues.  And to support to a friend who is currently having to fight claims against him on First Amendment grounds.

extras.title: EP&E S306E 01/PLSC S228E 01 - Freedom of Speech and Ethics
